title: Interactive Gene Cluster Visualizations in R
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(GCVieweR) ## basic example code

what: Create a GC Chart Visualization — GC_chart
title: Create a GC Chart Visualization — GC_chart
text: Generates interactive GC chart genomic data.

title: Create a GC Chart Visualization — GC_chart
code: GC_chart(   data,   start = "start",   stop = "stop",   cluster = NULL,   group = NULL,   width = "100%",   height = "400px",   background_color = "#0000",   elementId = NULL,   scale_breaks = TRUE,   scale_break_threshold = 20,   scale_break_padding = 1 )

title: Create a GC Chart Visualization — GC_chart
text: data Data frame containing genomic information. start Column name indicates start positions. Default "start". stop Column name indicates stop positions. Default "stop". cluster Optional column name used clustering purposes. Default NULL. group Column name used gene grouping influence color aesthetics. width Width specification chart, '100%' 500. Default unspecified. height Height specification chart, '400px' 300. Default unspecified. elementId Optional identifier string widget. Default NULL. scale_breaks Logical flag indicating scale breaks employed. Default TRUE. scale_break_threshold Numeric value indicating threshold percentage entire range determining inter-gene regions suitable scale breaks. Default unspecified. scale_break_padding Numeric value indicating padding percentage entire range either side scale break. Default unspecified.

title: Create a GC Chart Visualization — GC_chart
text: GC chart widget.

title: Create a GC Chart Visualization — GC_chart
code:
genes_data <- data.frame( start = c(10, 50, 90, 130, 170, 210), stop = c(40, 80, 120, 160, 200, 240), name = c('Gene 1', 'Gene 2', 'Gene 3', 'Gene 4', 'Gene 5', 'Gene 6'), group = c('A', 'A', 'B', 'B', 'A', 'C'), cluster = c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2) ) GC_chart(genes_data, group = "group", cluster = "cluster") %>% GC_labels("name") {"x":{"data":{"start":[10,50,90,130,170,210],"stop":[40,80,120,160,200,240],"name":["Gene 1","Gene 2","Gene 3","Gene 4","Gene 5","Gene 6"],"group":["A","A","B","B","A","C"],"cluster":[1,1,1,2,2,2],"rowID":[1,2,3,4,5,6]},"group":"group","backgroundColor":"#0000","legend":{"group":"group","show":true,"position":"top","backgroundColor":"#0000"},"series":{"1":{"clusterName":"1","data":{"start":[90,50,10],"stop":[120,80,40],"name":["Gene 3","Gene 2","Gene 1"],"group":["B","A","A"],"cluster":["1","1","1"],"rowID":[3,2,1]},"scale":{"breaks":[]},"grid":{"margin":{"left":"50px","right":"50px","top":0,"bottom":0},"height":"200px","width":"100%"},"style":{"backgroundColor":"#0000"},"title":[],"genes":{"group":"group","show":true},"labels":{"label":"name","show":true,"itemStyle":[]},"cluster":[],"coordinates":{"show":false},"scaleBar":[],"footer":[],"clusterLabel":[],"sequence":{"show":true},"tooltip":{"show":true,"formatter":"Start:<\/b> {start}
Stop:<\/b> {stop}"}},"2":{"clusterName":"2","data":{"start":[210,170,130],"stop":[240,200,160],"name":["Gene 6","Gene 5","Gene 4"],"group":["C","A","B"],"cluster":["2","2","2"],"rowID":[6,5,4]},"scale":{"breaks":[]},"grid":{"margin":{"left":"50px","right":"50px","top":0,"bottom":0},"height":"200px","width":"100%"},"style":{"backgroundColor":"#0000"},"title":[],"genes":{"group":"group","show":true},"labels":{"label":"name","show":true,"itemStyle":[]},"cluster":[],"coordinates":{"show":false},"scaleBar":[],"footer":[],"clusterLabel":[],"sequence":{"show":true},"tooltip":{"show":true,"formatter":"Start:<\/b> {start}
Stop:<\/b> {stop}"}}}},"evals":[],"jsHooks":[]}

what: Set or Update Cluster Labels for a GC Chart — GC_clusterLabel
title: Set or Update Cluster Labels for a GC Chart — GC_clusterLabel
text: function allows set update labels specified clusters within GC chart. provides flexibility terms title, visibility, width, position, additional customization options.

title: Set or Update Cluster Labels for a GC Chart — GC_clusterLabel
code: GC_clusterLabel(   GC_chart,   title = NULL,   show = TRUE,   width = "100px",   cluster = NULL,   position = "left",   ... )

title: Set or Update Cluster Labels for a GC Chart — GC_clusterLabel
text: GC_chart GC chart object. title Character vector. title cluster label. Default NULL. show Logical. Whether show cluster label. Default TRUE. width Character. width cluster label. Default "100px". cluster Numeric character vector. Clusters GC chart update. Default NULL. position Character. Position label, either "left" "right". Default "left". ... Additional customization arguments cluster label.

title: Set or Update Cluster Labels for a GC Chart — GC_clusterLabel
text: Updated GC chart new modified cluster labels.

title: Set or Update Cluster Labels for a GC Chart — GC_clusterLabel
code:
genes_data <- data.frame( start = c(10, 90, 130, 170, 210), stop = c(40, 120, 160, 200, 240), name = c('Gene 1', 'Gene 3', 'Gene 4', 'Gene 5', 'Gene 6'), group = c('A', 'B', 'B', 'A', 'C'), cluster = c(1, 1, 2, 2, 2) ) # Set cluster labels GC_chart(genes_data, cluster ="cluster", group = "group") %>% GC_clusterLabel(title = unique(genes_data$cluster)) {"x":{"data":{"start":[10,90,130,170,210],"stop":[40,120,160,200,240],"name":["Gene 1","Gene 3","Gene 4","Gene 5","Gene 6"],"group":["A","B","B","A","C"],"cluster":[1,1,2,2,2],"rowID":[1,2,3,4,5]},"group":"group","backgroundColor":"#0000","legend":{"group":"group","show":true,"position":"top","backgroundColor":"#0000"},"series":{"1":{"clusterName":"1","data":{"start":[90,10],"stop":[120,40],"name":["Gene 3","Gene 1"],"group":["B","A"],"cluster":["1","1"],"rowID":[2,1]},"scale":{"breaks":[{"start":42.11,"stop":87.89}]},"grid":{"margin":{"left":"100px","right":"50px","top":0,"bottom":0},"height":"200px","width":"100%"},"style":{"backgroundColor":"#0000"},"title":[],"genes":{"group":"group","show":true},"labels":{"group":"group","show":true},"cluster":[],"coordinates":{"show":false},"scaleBar":[],"footer":[],"clusterLabel":{"title":1,"show":true,"position":"left"},"sequence":{"show":true},"tooltip":{"show":true,"formatter":"Start:<\/b> {start}

what: Add a Footer to Each Cluster in a GC Chart — GC_footer
title: Add a Footer to Each Cluster in a GC Chart — GC_footer
text: function allows add footer specific clusters within GC chart. can specify titles, subtitles, control display styling.

title: Add a Footer to Each Cluster in a GC Chart — GC_footer
code: GC_footer(   GC_chart,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   height = NULL,   show = TRUE,   cluster = NULL,   subtitleFont = list(),   titleFont = list(),   ... )

title: Add a Footer to Each Cluster in a GC Chart — GC_footer
text: GC_chart GC chart object footers added . title Character vector NULL. title displayed footer. Multiple titles can provided different clusters, recycled clusters titles. Default NULL. subtitle Character vector NULL. Subtitles accompany main titles. Default NULL. height Character vector NULL. height footer, can vary clusters. Default NULL. show Logical vector. Controls visibility footer. Default TRUE clusters. cluster Numeric character vector specifying clusters footers added updated. NULL, clusters updated. Default NULL. ... Additional arguments customization footers.

title: Add a Footer to Each Cluster in a GC Chart — GC_footer
text: GC chart object updated footer settings specified cluster.

title: Add a Footer to Each Cluster in a GC Chart — GC_footer
code:
genes_data <- data.frame( start = c(10, 90, 130, 170, 210), stop = c(40, 120, 160, 200, 240), name = c('Gene 1', 'Gene 3', 'Gene 4', 'Gene 5', 'Gene 6'), group = c('A', 'B', 'B', 'A', 'C'), cluster = c(1, 1, 2, 2, 2) ) # Add a simple footer with subtitle to all clusters GC_chart(genes_data, cluster = "cluster", group = "group") %>% GC_footer( title = "Cluster Footer", subtitle = "Cluster subtitle" ) {"x":{"data":{"start":[10,90,130,170,210],"stop":[40,120,160,200,240],"name":["Gene 1","Gene 3","Gene 4","Gene 5","Gene 6"],"group":["A","B","B","A","C"],"cluster":[1,1,2,2,2],"rowID":[1,2,3,4,5]},"group":"group","backgroundColor":"#0000","legend":{"group":"group","show":true,"position":"top","backgroundColor":"#0000"},"series":{"1":{"clusterName":"1","data":{"start":[90,10],"stop":[120,40],"name":["Gene 3","Gene 1"],"group":["B","A"],"cluster":["1","1"],"rowID":[2,1]},"scale":{"breaks":[{"start":42.11,"stop":87.89}]},"grid":{"margin":{"left":"50px","right":"50px","top":0,"bottom":0},"height":"200px","width":"100%","bottom":"20px"},"style":{"backgroundColor":"#0000"},"title":[],"genes":{"group":"group","show":true},"labels":{"group":"group","show":true},"cluster":[],"coordinates":{"show":false},"scaleBar":[],"footer":{"title":"Cluster Footer","subtitle":"Cluster subtitle","show":true,"subtitleFont":[],"titleFont":[]},"clusterLabel":[],"sequence":{"show":true},"tooltip":{"show":true,"formatter":"Start:<\/b> {start}
Stop:<\/b> {stop}"}},"2":{"clusterName":"2","data":{"start":[210,170,130],"stop":[240,200,160],"name":["Gene 6","Gene 5","Gene 4"],"group":["C","A","B"],"cluster":["2","2","2"],"rowID":[5,4,3]},"scale":{"breaks":[]},"grid":{"margin":{"left":"50px","right":"50px","top":0,"bottom":0},"height":"200px","width":"100%","bottom":"20px"},"style":{"backgroundColor":"#0000"},"title":[],"genes":{"group":"group","show":true},"labels":{"group":"group","show":true},"cluster":[],"coordinates":{"show":false},"scaleBar":[],"footer":{"title":"Cluster Footer","subtitle":"Cluster subtitle","show":true,"subtitleFont":[],"titleFont":[]},"clusterLabel":[],"sequence":{"show":true},"tooltip":{"show":true,"formatter":"Start:<\/b> {start}
Stop:<\/b> {stop}"}}}},"evals":[],"jsHooks":[]}# Add styling to the title and sub title GC_chart(genes_data, cluster = "cluster", group = "group") %>% GC_footer( title = "This is a footer", subtitle = "Subtitle for the footer", height = "15px", spacing = 15, show = TRUE, cluster = 1, x = 6, y = -20, position = "middle", # right / middle spacing = 12, titleFont = list( fontSize = "12px", fontWeight = "bold", fontFamily = "sans-serif", fill = "black", cursor = "default" ), subtitleFont = list( fill = "grey", fontSize = "10px", fontStyle = "normal", fontFamily = "sans-serif", cursor = "default" ) ) {"x":{"data":{"start":[10,90,130,170,210],"stop":[40,120,160,200,240],"name":["Gene 1","Gene 3","Gene 4","Gene 5","Gene 6"],"group":["A","B","B","A","C"],"cluster":[1,1,2,2,2],"rowID":[1,2,3,4,5]},"group":"group","backgroundColor":"#0000","legend":{"group":"group","show":true,"position":"top","backgroundColor":"#0000"},"series":{"1":{"clusterName":"1","data":{"start":[90,10],"stop":[120,40],"name":["Gene 3","Gene 1"],"group":["B","A"],"cluster":["1","1"],"rowID":[2,1]},"scale":{"breaks":[{"start":42.11,"stop":87.89}]},"grid":{"margin":{"left":"50px","right":"50px","top":0,"bottom":0},"height":"200px","width":"100%","bottom":"15px"},"style":{"backgroundColor":"#0000"},"title":[],"genes":{"group":"group","show":true},"labels":{"group":"group","show":true},"cluster":[],"coordinates":{"show":false},"scaleBar":[],"footer":{"title":"This is a footer","subtitle":"Subtitle for the footer","show":true,"subtitleFont":{"fill":"grey","fontSize":"10px","fontStyle":"normal","fontFamily":"sans-serif","cursor":"default"},"titleFont":{"fontSize":"12px","fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"sans-serif","fill":"black","cursor":"default"},"spacing":15,"x":6,"y":-20,"position":"middle"},"clusterLabel":[],"sequence":{"show":true},"tooltip":{"show":true,"formatter":"Start:<\/b> {start}

what: Modify Gene Characteristics within a Chart — GC_genes
title: Modify Gene Characteristics within a Chart — GC_genes
text: function updates gene chart specific characteristics genes based given parameters. can show/hide genes, apply color scheme, assign custom colors, filter cluster, accept additional options.

title: Modify Gene Characteristics within a Chart — GC_genes
code: GC_genes(   GC_chart,   group = NULL,   show = TRUE,   colorScheme = NULL,   customColors = NULL,   cluster = NULL,   ... )

title: Modify Gene Characteristics within a Chart — GC_genes
text: GC_chart gene chart object modified. group Character NULL, groups show hide chart. NULL, group taken chart object. show Logical, whether show genes . colorScheme Character NULL, name color scheme use. customColors List NULL, custom colors apply genes. cluster Numeric character, specific cluster filter genes . ... Additional arguments passed gene options.

title: Modify Gene Characteristics within a Chart — GC_genes
text: Returns modified gene chart object.

title: Modify Gene Characteristics within a Chart — GC_genes
code:
genes_data <- data.frame( start = c(10, 90, 130, 170, 210), stop = c(40, 120, 160, 200, 240), name = c('Gene 1', 'Gene 3', 'Gene 4', 'Gene 5', 'Gene 6'), group = c('A', 'B', 'B', 'A', 'C'), cluster = c(1, 1, 2, 2, 2) ) # Change the appearance of a specific gene cluster GC_chart(genes_data, cluster = "cluster", group = "group") %>% GC_genes( group = "group", show = TRUE, colorScheme = NULL, # One of D3.js build in colorSchemes # (eg. Stop:<\/b> {stop}"}},"2":{"clusterName":"2","data":{"start":[210,170,130],"stop":[240,200,160],"name":["Gene 6","Gene 5","Gene 4"],"group":["C","A","B"],"cluster":["2","2","2"],"rowID":[5,4,3]},"scale":{"breaks":[]},"grid":{"margin":{"left":"50px","right":"50px","top":0,"bottom":0},"height":"200px","width":"100%"},"style":{"backgroundColor":"#0000"},"title":[],"genes":{"group":"group","show":true},"labels":{"group":"group","show":true},"cluster":[],"coordinates":{"show":false},"scaleBar":[],"footer":[],"clusterLabel":[],"sequence":{"show":true},"tooltip":{"show":true,"formatter":"Start:<\/b> {start}

what: Update Grid Display of a GC Chart Cluster — GC_grid
title: Update Grid Display of a GC Chart Cluster — GC_grid
text: Modify grid display specified clusters within GC chart. function allows users adjust margins, width, height grid cluster.

title: Update Grid Display of a GC Chart Cluster — GC_grid
code: GC_grid(GC_chart, margin = NULL, width = NULL, height = NULL, cluster = NULL)

title: Update Grid Display of a GC Chart Cluster — GC_grid
text: GC_chart GC chart object. margin list specifying top, right, bottom, left margins. width Numeric character. Width grid. numeric, considered percentage. height Numeric. Height grid. cluster Numeric character vector. Clusters GC chart update.

title: Update Grid Display of a GC Chart Cluster — GC_grid
text: Updated GC chart new grid display settings.

title: Update Grid Display of a GC Chart Cluster — GC_grid

what: Set Legend for a Gene Chart — GC_legend
title: Set Legend for a Gene Chart — GC_legend
text: function configures legend gene chart. can toggle legend's visibility, apply color scheme, assign custom colors, set custom labels legend entries.

title: Set Legend for a Gene Chart — GC_legend
code: GC_legend(   GC_chart,   group = NULL,   show = TRUE,   colorScheme = NULL,   customColors = NULL,   backgroundColor = "white",   labels = NULL,   ... )

title: Set Legend for a Gene Chart — GC_legend
text: GC_chart gene chart object modified. group Optional; character NULL, groups include legend. NULL, groups taken 'group' attribute 'GC_chart' object. show Logical, whether display legend . colorScheme Optional; character NULL, name color scheme apply legend. can one D3.js's built-color schemes (e.g., "schemeCategory10", "schemeAccent", "schemeTableau10"). customColors Optional; list NULL, custom colors apply legend entries. labels Optional; character NULL, custom labels legend entries. ... Additional arguments passed legend configuration.

title: Set Legend for a Gene Chart — GC_legend
text: Returns gene chart object legend configured.

title: Set Legend for a Gene Chart — GC_legend
code: genes_data <- data.frame(   start = c(10, 90, 130, 170, 210),   stop = c(40, 120, 160, 200, 240),   name = c('Gene 1', 'Gene 3', 'Gene 4', 'Gene 5', 'Gene 6'),   group = c('A', 'B', 'B', 'A', 'C') )  # Assuming GC_chart is a function that creates a gene chart object GC_chart(genes_data, cluster = "cluster", group = "group") %>%   GC_legend(     position = "top", #bottom     orientation = "horizontal", #vertical     x = 10,     y = 10,     adjustHeight = TRUE,     labels = NULL, # c('Group A', 'Group B', 'Group C'),     legendOptions = list(       cursor = "pointer",       colorScheme = NULL,       customColors = NULL # c("red", "green", "orange")       # Additional styles     ),     legendTextOptions = list(       cursor = "pointer",       textAnchor = "start",       dy = ".35em",       fontSize = "12px",       fontFamily = "sans-serif",       fill = "black"       # Additional styles     ),   ) #> Error in GC_chart(genes_data, cluster = "cluster", group = "group"): cluster column not found in data  # Configure the legend of the gene chart gene_chart_modified <- gene_chart %>%   GC_legend(     show = TRUE,     colorScheme = 'schemeCategory10', # Example color scheme     customColors = list('A' = 'blue', 'B' = 'green', 'C' = 'red'),     labels = c('Group A', 'Group B', 'Group C')   ) #> Error in GC_legend(., show = TRUE, colorScheme = "schemeCategory10", customColors = list(A = "blue",     B = "green", C = "red"), labels = c("Group A", "Group B",     "Group C")): object 'gene_chart' not found

GC_tooltip( GC_chart, formatter = "Start: {start}
Stop: {stop}", show = TRUE, cluster = NULL, ... )

title: Set Tooltip for a Gene Chart — GC_tooltip
text: GC_chart gene chart object modified. formatter character string defining HTML content tooltip. can include placeholders like `start` `stop` replaced actual data values. default value shows start stop data. show Logical, whether display tooltip . cluster Optional; used specify clusters chart tooltips. ... Additional arguments can used customize tooltip.

title: Set Tooltip for a Gene Chart — GC_tooltip
text: Returns gene chart object tooltip configured.

title: Set Tooltip for a Gene Chart — GC_tooltip
code:
# Set tooltip genes_data <- data.frame( start = c(10, 90, 130, 170, 210), stop = c(40, 120, 160, 200, 240), name = c('Gene 1', 'Gene 3', 'Gene 4', 'Gene 5', 'Gene 6'), group = c('A', 'B', 'B', 'A', 'C') ) # Add tooltips to the gene chart GC_chart(genes_data, cluster = "cluster", group = "group") %>% GC_tooltip(formatter = " Start: {start}
Stop: {stop}") #> Error in GC_chart(genes_data, cluster = "cluster", group = "group"): cluster column not found in data
